duties_responsibilities.duty: Ensure an educational, caring, and safe child development program to meet the developmental needs of children served by the center.
Manage and supervise the staff, program, and day-to-day operations of the Child Development Center.
Maintain awareness of trends and best practices related to children, families, poverty, and homelessness.
Act as the Instructional Leader in a birth to five child development center.
Ensure compliance with agency policies, state licensing standards, and other regulatory entities.
Develop and monitor expenses monthly to ensure adherence to budget projections and/or revise as needed.
Supervise the instructional staff and non-educational support staff, and lead collaborative curriculum planning.
Refer families and children to appropriate community resources.
Screen, interview, and hire staff in collaboration with the Director of Child and Family Services.
Review the performance of each direct report and communicate the results to the employee and the Director of Child and Family Services.

education_certification.credential: BA/BS or MA in Early Childhood Education, or a closely related field.
